title: Hyundai Venue, Verna, Grand i10 Nios line-ups updated for 2025
description: Hyundai India has updated the line-ups for three of its models: the Venue compact SUV, the Verna mid-size sedan and the Grand i10 Nios hatchback. All three cars get a respective new mid-spec variant, while select trims have been updated with additional features. Hyundai Venue SX Executive introduced with 1.2-litre petrol-MT Hyundai Grand i10 Nios Sportz (O) launched Hyundai Verna gets new automatic variants Hyundai Venue 2025 updates The Venue compact SUV now gets a SX Executive trim with the 83hp, 1.2-litre petrol engine in manual form. This Rs 10.79 lakh trim gets features such as an 8-inch infotainment touchscreen, automatic climate control, wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, keyless entry and go, and a sunroof. Hyundai has also updated the S and S+ manual trims with a rear camera and a wireless charger, the S(O) MT variant with the keyless entry and go feature, the S(O) Knight Edition with a wireless charger, and added the aforementioned kit to the S(O)+ Adventure MT variant. The table below shows prices for the new Venue variant and that prices for the updated variants have increased by Rs 10,000-22,000. It should be noted that the Venue 1.0 turbo-petrol and diesel line-ups remain unchanged. Priced between Rs 7.72 lakh and Rs 8.29 lakh, the Sportz (O) gets features such as 15-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels, an 8-inch infotainment touchscreen, automatic climate control, Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, keyless entry and go, and chromed outside door handles. The Korean brand has also updated the Corporate variant – also available in manual and AMT form – with projector headlights. Prices for the Nios Corporate have increased by Rs 16,000. Notable features on the Verna S CVT variant include a sunroof, drive modes (Eco, Normal, Sport) and paddle-shifters. Meanwhile, the Verna S(O) DCT features kit like blacked-out 16-inch alloy wheels, front brake calipers finished in red, a sunroof, an 8-inch infotainment touchscreen, wireless Android Auto and  Apple CarPlay, automatic climate control, a wireless charger, and a rear camera. In addition, the Verna S MT variant now also features a sunroof, which has seen its price rise by Rs 32,000. html:
All three models now get new mid-spec variants, while select trims get additional features.

Hyundai India has updated the line-ups for three of its models: the Venue compact SUV, the Verna mid-size sedan and the Grand i10 Nios hatchback. All three cars get a respective new mid-spec variant, while select trims have been updated with additional features.

  1. Hyundai Venue SX Executive introduced with 1.2-litre petrol-MT
  2. Hyundai Grand i10 Nios Sportz (O) launched
  3. Hyundai Verna gets new automatic variants

Hyundai Venue 2025 updates

The Venue compact SUV now gets a SX Executive trim with the 83hp, 1.2-litre petrol engine in manual form. This Rs 10.79 lakh trim gets features such as an 8-inch infotainment touchscreen, automatic climate control, wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, keyless entry and go, and a sunroof.

Hyundai has also updated the S and S+ manual trims with a rear camera and a wireless charger, the S(O) MT variant with the keyless entry and go feature, the S(O) Knight Edition with a wireless charger, and added the aforementioned kit to the S(O)+ Adventure MT variant.

The table below shows prices for the new Venue variant and that prices for the updated variants have increased by Rs 10,000-22,000. It should be noted that the Venue 1.0 turbo-petrol and diesel line-ups remain unchanged.

Hyundai Venue 1.2 new variants and prices (ex-showroom, India, in Rs, lakh)
VariantNew priceOld priceDifference
S MT9.289.110.17
S+ MT9.539.360.17
S(O) MT9.999.890.10
S(O) Knight MT10.3510.130.22
S(O)+ Adventure MT10.3710.150.22
SX Executive MT10.79--

Hyundai Grand i10 Nios 2025 updates

The Grand i10 Nios Sportz (O) trim is available with the manual gearbox and the AMT option. Priced between Rs 7.72 lakh and Rs 8.29 lakh, the Sportz (O) gets features such as 15-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels, an 8-inch infotainment touchscreen, automatic climate control, Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, keyless entry and go, and chromed outside door handles.

The Korean brand has also updated the Corporate variant – also available in manual and AMT form – with projector headlights. Prices for the Nios Corporate have increased by Rs 16,000.

Hyundai Grand i10 Nios new variants and prices (ex-showroom, India, in Rs, lakh)
VariantNew priceOld priceDifference
Corporate MT7.096.930.16
Sportz (O) MT7.72--
Corporate AMT7.747.580.16
Sportz (O) AMT8.29--

Hyundai Verna 2025 updates

The Hyundai Verna petrol line-up is now more approachable with the new S CVT variant for the 115hp, 1.5-litre petrol engine, and the S(O) DCT variant for the 160hp, 1.5-litre turbo-petrol unit. Notable features on the Verna S CVT variant include a sunroof, drive modes (Eco, Normal, Sport) and paddle-shifters. Meanwhile, the Verna S(O) DCT features kit like blacked-out 16-inch alloy wheels, front brake calipers finished in red, a sunroof, an 8-inch infotainment touchscreen, wireless Android Auto and  Apple CarPlay, automatic climate control, a wireless charger, and a rear camera.

In addition, the Verna S MT variant now also features a sunroof, which has seen its price rise by Rs 32,000.
